channel.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Meet San Jose State volleyball star Blaire Fleming, who ignited controversy over transgender athlete participation
item.description: Blaire Fleming, a talented San Jose State volleyball player, has sparked national debate on transgender athletes in women's sports. Despite leading her team to the Mountain West tournament final, her inclusion has faced criticism and legal challenges from teammates and opponents, citing unfair physical advantages. Investigations found insufficient evidence to support these claims.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: RFK jr appears naked taking a shower in Cheryl Hines' video: 'Grifting weirdos'
item.description: ​Donald Trump's health secretary of the incoming administration appeared taking a shower in an Instagram live of his wife where she was announcing discounts on her beauty products. Hines pretended that it was not all planned and acted surprised asking for a minute for her video. “You can’t take a shower, I’m doing a video! No, no, no, I’m doing a… you’ve gotta give me a second I’m doing a video for Hines+Young. Honey… 60% off,” Hines said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Bushra Bibi rejected Imran Khan's agreement to move protest venue
item.description: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif said former PM Imran Khan agreed to move a protest outside Islamabad. However, his wife, Bushra Bibi, refused, resulting in violent clashes and several casualties. The government formed an anti-riot force, accusing PTI of misinformation and old or AI-generated images.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vindman's accusation and Elon Musk's 'will pay price' threat: Here's what happened
item.description: Retired Army Lt Col Alexander Vindman clashed with Elon Musk after calling Musk out for leaking state secrets to Russian president Putin. In response, Musk accused Vindman of treason and being on the payroll of Ukrainian oligarchs. Vindman defended himself, stating Musk's accusations were unfounded and motivated by a desire to silence critics.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Relations with India changed after Hasina's ouster': Bangladesh foreign adviser
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Myanmar navy fires at Thai fishing boats, detains 31 fishermen, Thailand says
item.description: Myanmar's navy fired on Thai fishing vessels, resulting in one fisherman drowning and the detention of 31 crew members. The incident occurred after two boats strayed into Myanmar's waters. Thai authorities are negotiating for their release and assessing potential violations of international law. The Thai foreign ministry and the Myanmar junta have been involved in addressing the situation.

item.title: Real reason why Harry and Meghan professionally separated, German filmmaker reveals
item.description: Harry and Meghan's Archewell Foundation was doomed to fail, reveals the German director of a bombshell documentary, as the ex-royals worked only an hour per week for the foundation. The donations dwindled in one year and their ambition to become global benefactors bringing about tangible changes came crashing down forcing them to choose separate paths professionally.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy dangled me off 17th floor balcony, slammed into furniture: Designer's explosive claim
item.description: Fashion designer Bryana Bana Bongolan has filed a $10 million lawsuit against Sean Diddy, alleging sexual battery, emotional distress, and false imprisonment. Bongolan claims Diddy threatened to kill her, physically assaulted her, and terrorized her during their association. She witnessed Diddy's abusive behavior towards his girlfriend, Cassie Ventura, and endured direct threats from him.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Old video of Trudeau mocking Trump viral as Canada PM dines with President-elect
item.description: A 2019 video of Justin Trudeau mocking Donald Trump has gone viral as the Canadian PM flew to Florida to meet President-elect Trump following Trump's tariff threat. ​In the footage, Trudeau, Boris Johnson, Emmanuel Macron were in a huddle at a function at Buckingham Palace. Johnson asked Macron: "Is that why he was late?" to which Trudeau said: "He was late because he talked a 40-minute press conference off the top".
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'He wasn't sorry': 72-year-old shot dead in Florida over loud music dispute
item.description: A 72-year-old man, Hurleyeon McLean, was shot and killed by his neighbor in Florida's Somerset Drive apartments following a disagreement over loud music. McLean went to speak with the neighbor after a noise complaint, leading to an altercation where McLean was fatally shot. The neighbor also threatened McLean's wife.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tragic murder-suicide: Model kills husband before taking her own life in luxury Florida home
item.description: In a tragic incident at their Florida high-rise condo, model Sabrina Krasniqi, 27, reportedly shot her husband, Pajtim Krasniqi, 34, multiple times before taking her own life. The bodies were discovered early Wednesday morning on the balcony. A gunfire detection system recorded six shots. The motive remains unclear as police continue their investigation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sikh community provides many free thanksgiving meal across US
item.description: A Sikh charity in New Jersey, 'Let's Share a Meal', recently organised a communal feast, distributing over 10,000 vegetarian meals across five states. This initiative, inspired by Guru Nanak's teachings, involved 700 volunteers and aims to teach values of peace and community. Established efforts have now reached more than 1 million meals distributed nationwide.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Police in Moscow raid bars over 'LGBT propaganda'
item.description: Police in Moscow raided multiple bars early Saturday and arrested the director of a gay travel agency under laws criminalising "LGBT propaganda", state media reported. Russian security forces raided at least three bars and nightclubs overnight "as part of measures to combat LGBT propaganda", the state TASS news agency reported.

item.title: 9 arrested in connection with lawyer's murder during Bangladesh violence
At least 10 Baloch men forcibly disappeared by Pakistani forces sparks outrage among activists
item.description: In Balochistan, at least 10 Baloch men were reportedly forcibly disappeared by Pakistani forces in different areas, including Jiwani, Uthal, Turbat, and Karachi. While one individual returned home, human rights activists are alarmed by the escalating incidents of enforced disappearances, with over 50 people affected recently.

item.title: Vietnam parliament approves $67 billion high-speed railway project
item.description: Vietnam has approved a $67 billion high-speed railway project from Hanoi to Ho Chi Minh City, aiming to cut travel time from 30 hours to five. Slated to start in 2027 and complete by 2035, the 1,500-kilometre line will pass through 20 cities and provinces, enhancing regional connectivity and boosting GDP growth.

item.title: ‘Harry – The Lost Prince’: German documentary reveals the Duke of Sussex and wife Meghan’s 'life in exile'
item.description: A German documentary, 'Harry – The Lost Prince,' directed by Ulrike Grunewald, which airs on December 3, 2023, examines Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's life post-royalty in California, challenges faced, and their strained royal family relations following Queen Elizabeth II’s death and King Charles III’s health issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Can't make this c**p up': Martina Navratilova slams NY Times over transgender athlete coverage
item.description: Martina Navratilova criticizes The New York Times for referring to biological females as 'non-transgender women.' The controversy involves forfeits in college volleyball due to Blaire Fleming, a transgender player, leading to lawsuits and safety concerns. Navratilova also weighs in on boxer Imane Khelif's gender accusations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Germany accuses Turkish man of spying for Ankara
'Bangladesh govt merely bystander': RSS condemns 'inhuman atrocities against Hindus by Islamic extremists'
item.description: RSS condemns extremist violence against minorities in Bangladesh, urging the government to halt such atrocities and release imprisoned Iskcon monk Chinmoy Krishna Das. India emphasizes the interim Bangladesh government’s duty to protect all citizens amid rising violence, stressing the need for global opinion and efforts to address the crisis.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk
